rules: Rule1: Whenever a scheduled audit occurs at Facility Alpha, it follows that if the facility possesses a valid permit, then it operates legally.
Rule2: Either a scheduled audit happens at Facility Alpha or an unscheduled inspection occurs.
Rule3: Under the condition that an unscheduled inspection takes place at Facility Alpha, then if the facility has a valid permit, it operates legally.
Rule4: When major contamination occurs at Facility Alpha, then if it is not the case that a regulatory violation leads to temporary shutdown, criminal charges will be filed against the facility.
Rule5: A batch recall of Drug X implies that major contamination occurred at Facility Alpha.
Rule6: If supplier approval was granted for Chemical Y, then whenever Drug X uses that raw material and is manufactured at Facility Alpha, it meets quality standards.
Rule7: Either supplier approval exists for Chemical Y or emergency procurement was used for it.
Rule8: Under the condition of emergency procurement for Chemical Y, then if Drug X uses that raw material and is made at Facility Alpha, it meets quality standards.
Rule9: If Drug X passes clinical trials, then it receives FDA approval.
Rule10: Drug X passes clinical trials or it is manufactured at Facility Alpha.
Rule11: If Drug X is manufactured at Facility Alpha, then it passes quality control testing.
Rule12: Under the condition that Drug X meets quality standards, then if it contains active compound A, it is safe for consumption.
Rule13: If Drug X passes quality control testing, then it meets quality standards.
Rule14: Whenever Drug X is investigated by the FDA, it indicates that the product was recalled.
Rule15: Under the condition that it is not true that manufacturing Drug X at Facility Alpha leads to safety given active compound A, a regulatory violation is committed by the facility.
Rule16: Whenever it is not the case that manufacturing Drug X at Facility Alpha results in safety with active compound A, then temporary shutdown does not occur at the facility.
Rule17: Provided that it is not the case that Facility Alpha has a manufacturing license or non-safety triggers FDA investigation, the facility holds a valid permit.
Rule18: Under the condition that neither does Facility Alpha have a manufacturing license nor does non-safety result in FDA investigation, the facility does not operate legally.
Rule19: If a batch recall does not happen for Drug X, then Facility Alpha committed a minor infraction.
facts: Fact1: Drug X contains active compound A.
Fact2: Drug X uses raw material Chemical Y.
Fact3: It is not the case that criminal charges were filed against Facility Alpha.
Fact4: No minor infraction was committed by Facility Alpha.
Fact5: Drug X does not have FDA approval.
Fact6: Drug X was not recalled as a product.
Fact7: Facility Alpha does not hold a manufacturing license.

question: Drug X is safe for consumption.
